alert.note: Alert for Benton; Polk (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 2:11PM PST until December 08 at 2:31AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Polk and Benton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Above 27.0 feet, expect flooding of low lying and agricultural lands in the vicinity of Sarah Helmick State Park, Highway 99W, and Parker Road. Some secondary roads and rural access roads may be flooded at this point. Flooding along Buena Vista Rd near the confluence with the Willamette is also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM PST Wednesday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 27.6 feet late Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 415 AM PST.
